meanings.definition: To give a tenth of one's income or produce as a contribution to a religious organization.
meanings.sent1: Every Sunday, the faithful tithed a portion of their earnings to the church.
meanings.sent2: Last year, my family tithed a part of our harvest to support the local mosque.
meanings.sent3: The farmer tithed his best apples, hoping for a blessed apple pie in return.
meanings.sent4: She tithed her time to volunteering, planting seeds of kindness in the community.
meanings.sent5: The tradition of tithing dates back centuries, symbolizing generosity and gratitude.
